abstract: Verizon Communications on Thursday announced it would buy IT services provider Terremark Worldwide for $19 a share, representing a 35 percent premium to its closing price on Thursday.
snippet: Verizon Communications on Thursday announced it would buy IT services provider Terremark Worldwide for $19 a share, representing a 35 percent premium to its closing price on Thursday.
lead_paragraph: Verizon Communications on Thursday announced it would buy I.T. services provider Terremark Worldwide for $19 a share, in a deal valued at $1.4 billion.

headline.main: Verizon to Buy Terremark for $1.4 Billion
